cliftonccraig wrote:

> I think I know what's up! I was reading the changelist wrong. I
> thought the change list was saying the new exactly() method was in
> version-1.0.1 but it appears above the version-1.0.1 title which, I
> guess, means that it's in a later version. I'll look into the snapshot
> version. I know it'll be in there. I just get a little leary using
> snapshots and/or nightly builds.

If you want the latest and greatest features....

At any rate, in the worst case, you could have built your own 
InvocationMatcher, or whatever that thing is. A little scary at first, 
but likely not too difficult. Note that once() and exactly() are merely 
convenience methods to make the syntax easier on the eyes. They just 
create InvocationMatcher objects (or whatever they really are) that 
match the number of invocations on verify().
